newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian youth kills one teacher, wounds second.
newsitem.headline: Austrian youth kills one teacher, wounds second.

text.p: A 15-year-old Austrian shot dead a woman teacher and seriously injured another at a secondary school in the province of Lower Austria on Monday, local police said.
The boy, who has not been named, entered the school in Zoebern, 120 km (70 miles) south of Vienna, shortly before 3 p.m. armed with his father's Magnum 357 revolver, a police spokesman said.
He opened fire on the two women as they worked in the girls' craft room, then fled on his bicycle.
A 48-year-old woman, identified by police as Annemarie K, died at the scene from a shot to the head. Gertrude W, 39, was taken to hospital to receive treatment for a leg wound.
Police arrested the boy within minutes of the incident. Austrian television said he was frustrated by his failure to find a painting apprenticeship.
Police said they believed the boy had attended Zoebern secondary school as a pupil.
